channel.title: Black Mesa: Fix all the things #2
channel.description:
Some other improvements I have worked on over the past year have been visual additions to a few of our maps, one from the chapter Residue Processing and another from Forget About Freeman. What was interesting about two of the maps is that they were missing [url=https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Detail_props]detail sprites[/url]. I’d noticed over the course of fixing other things the compile log complaining about the detail sprite and detail texture settings not being defined correctly. I’d always passed this off as being intentional but decided to give them a try anyway to see what the results would be.
After a bit of tweaking I was surprised with the improvement it brought to the two areas in question and elected to keep it as is. Perhaps in the future there might be cause to revisit the actual detail sprites they use as im sure other improvements can always be made.
[b][i]Residue Processing: Before / After[/i][/b][/SIZE]
[url='https://i.imgur.com/XOudWOR.jpg']![](upload://jAzbPAtSinoocqbPeDfZzUomaGH.jpeg)[/url][url='https://i.imgur.com/F9dsQ9N.jpg']![](upload://vwojB2DKvJFrV06jZ4SZdYMzga8.jpeg)[/url]
[b][i]Forget About Freeman: Before / After[/i][/b][/SIZE]
[url='https://i.imgur.com/cEXnU6b.jpg']![](upload://3H3jogYprHtkPaOeytqezguBH81.jpeg)[/url][url='https://i.imgur.com/TsQUWEM.jpg']![](upload://jzxl4YhrxwOymRiEiexwMj3KeRA.jpeg)[/url]
[url='https://imgur.com/a/MQzjV']Gallery Link[/url]
Another improvement has been an implementation of the VOX sounds. these were unfortunately removed by accident from the 2007 release. Right now as it stands it plays in part of the chapter We’ve Got Hostiles but I would like to add bits of it to other chapters where appropriate (places like PU and BP)
[url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HLHzLrPWWx8']![](upload://9oP3xAK33RkCnE1wnYAvNsN6GLj.jpeg)[/url]
In the video I am firing the speaker to play more rapidly to give an impression of the vox, so it wouldn’t play as frequently as that.

item.title: Black Mesa: Fix all the things #2
item.dc:creator: Cpl.1nsane
item.description:
Dadster:
  1. Reduce the length of time for the pauses between words in the VOX announcements - makes it appear like the “announcer” is mentally/physically challenged. The announcements are way too drawn out/extended. Make their pacing closer to as they are in HL.

It’s a fair point, some of the vox wavs have longer dead audio after them than others (to give natural pauses), but I can easily adjust for those in the sentences files.

MasterShadic2:

Make more stuff move…I just like it when pieces of the background have subtle movements. Is it hard to make grass sway back and forth? I have little knowledge of things like this. I just…really like swaying grass.

It’s an interesting thought, I’ll add it to my never ending to do list.

ysrael214:

Is the vox in Lambda Core still “under military command”?

LC might have some small snippets of vox near the beginning of the chapter that links to FaF and possibly some relating to actions the player is taking throughout.

danielsangeo:

They do have sideways references to HL2 in the mod. For example, if you blow up the food in the microwave at the beginning, the scientist sitting at the table says, “We will never hear the end of this.” This is a direct reference to Arne Magnusson near the end of Half-Life 2:Episode 2, without actually mentioning his name.

I believe Eli mentions either Alyx or his wife by name after the disaster if you idle enough around him, or keep hitting E on him.

Or I could be remembering un-used files in the VO folder for the mod.
